trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> function checks the consistency of a <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> table.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> function checks the consistency of a <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> table.

target.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> function checks the consistency of a <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> table.

trans-unit.source: In particular, the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> function verifies the following conditions:

seg-source.mrk: In particular, the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> function verifies the following conditions:

target.mrk: In particular, the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> function verifies the following conditions:

trans-unit.source: Base tables and all associated indexes contain the same number of rows

seg-source.mrk: Base tables and all associated indexes contain the same number of rows

target.mrk: Base tables and all associated indexes contain the same number of rows

trans-unit.source: The values and row locations in each index match those of the base table

seg-source.mrk: The values and row locations in each index match those of the base table

target.mrk: The values and row locations in each index match those of the base table

trans-unit.source: All BTREE indexes are internally consistent

seg-source.mrk: All BTREE indexes are internally consistent

target.mrk: All BTREE indexes are internally consistent

trans-unit.source: You run this function in an SQL statement, as follows:

seg-source.mrk: You run this function in an SQL statement, as follows:

target.mrk: You run this function in an SQL statement, as follows:

trans-unit.source: where SchemaName and TableName are expressions that evaluate to a string data type. If you created a schema or table name as a non-delimited identifier, you must present their names in all upper case. For example:

seg-source.mrk: where SchemaName and TableName are expressions that evaluate to a string data type.
If you created a schema or table name as a non-delimited identifier, you must present their names in all upper case.

target.mrk: where SchemaName and TableName are expressions that evaluate to a string data type.
If you created a schema or table name as a non-delimited identifier, you must present their names in all upper case.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> function returns a SMALLINT. If the table is consistent (or if you run <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> on a view), <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> returns a non-zero value. Otherwise, the function throws an exception on the first inconsistency that it finds.

seg-source.mrk: If the table is consistent (or if you run <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> on a view), <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> returns a non-zero value.
Otherwise, the function throws an exception on the first inconsistency that it finds.

target.mrk: If the table is consistent (or if you run <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> on a view), <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> returns a non-zero value.
Otherwise, the function throws an exception on the first inconsistency that it finds.
